Text: NYISO TCC Autumn Initial TCC Auction Notice of Rockland Electric Company Separation from writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List The five remaining rounds of the Initial Autumn TCC Auction for SixMonth TCCs will be conducted with the Rockland Electric Company portion of Orange Rockland Utilities Inc represented as external to the New York Control Area NYCA This will reduce the load in Zone G Hudson Valley PTID by approximately percent No individual generator PTIDs are affected by this change

NYISO TCC October TCC Reconfiguration Auction Notice of Delay and New Bidding writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List The October TCC Reconfiguration Auction bids and offers were received on Monday On Wednesday at least one Market Participant asked to adjust its bids based on Tuesdays tragic events in New York City citing a material change in circumstances The NYISO has determined that it would be inappropriate to allow one Market Participant to change its bids at this time but recognizes that the circumstances upon which all bids were based may have changed Therefore the NYISO has decided to delay posting of auction results for the October TCC Reconfiguration Auction to allow each Market Participant an opportunity to review its bids and offers and if deemed appropriate adjust them All bids and offers received on Monday will be invalidated Market Participants may submit their bids and offers during the new Bidding Period scheduled for Friday The revised schedule for the October TCC Reconfiguration Auction is as follows September The Bidding Period opens at AM and closes at PM September The NYISO will conduct the required award analysis for this auction September The NYISO will post the results of this auction Buyers who were awarded TCCs will be notified by the NYISO using email no later than PM September The NYISO distributes Award Notices to purchasers and sellers of TCCs September Any dispute regarding an Award Notice must be submitted in writing to the NYISO by PM September Payments due to NYISO by PM for TCCs awarded October The NYISO makes payment for all TCCs sold during the October Reconfiguration Auction October The NYISO distributes any residual auction revenues from the October Reconfiguration Auction to the Transmission Owners The schedule for the remainder of the Autumn Initial TCC Auction is unaffected

NYISO TCC Autumn Initial TCC Auction Notice of Rockland Electric Company Separation from writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List The five remaining rounds of the Initial Autumn TCC Auction for SixMonth TCCs will be conducted with the Rockland Electric Company portion of Orange Rockland Utilities Inc represented as external to the New York Control Area NYCA This will reduce the load in Zone G Hudson Valley PTID by approximately percent No individual generator PTIDs are affected by this change

NYISO TCC Autumn Initial TCC Auction Posting of Rules Procedures and writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List The Rules Procedures and Guidelines for the Initial Auction of TCCs Autumn has been posted on the NYISO web site It can be found on the NYISO web site by selecting THE MARKETS from the home page Then select Transmission Congestion Contracts TCC Market and Autumn The document is posted under the heading Autumn TCC Auction This document contains the Sale Agreement which must be completed and returned to the NYISO via an overnight mail service by PM on August th and the Purchase Agreement which must be completed and returned to the NYISO via an overnight mail service by PM on August th in order to participate in the first round of the auction Parties not wishing to participate in the first round of the auction may submit the Sale Agreement and Purchase Agreement at a later date in accordance with the Time Line provided as Attachment C of the Rules Please note that these Agreements are identical to those used for the Spring Initial Auction of TCCs except for the relevant date references The final version of the Time Line provided as Attachment C differs from the Preliminary Time Line posted on August th The Reconfiguration Auctions of TwoYear and OneYear TCCs were shifted to Rounds and
